result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Mark Chandler

records.descr: Order on Request to Appear Remotely

records.addlTxt:
8:43 AM Defendant Joshua Mark Chandler appeared by video from the Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for Joshua Mark Chandler.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in jail on this date. Atty DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint. Court enters not guilty plea on misdemeanor. Atty Rockrow askes for the preliminary hearing to be set within time limits. Court sets Preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Mark Chandler
Current: 3181 Runway Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54703   (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 3181 Broadway Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54703
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: NO CONTACT WITH ANY JUVENILE UNDER THE AGE OF 17 YEARS OLD.   No Possession of electronic devices for purposes of accessing the internet.

11:09 AM DE Joshua Chandler in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Alysja Otten (special appearance) by video. Bruce R Poquette appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Otten argues bond.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for  11/1/2022 at 8:30AM.  

CBS $10,000 NO CONTACT WITH ANY JUVENILE UNDER THE AGE OF 17 YEARS OLD.   No Possession of electronic devices for purposes of accessing the internet.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
